name: haughtily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an unfriendly way and seeming to consider yourself better than other people: She haughtily informed Carl that the elevator she was on was "for members only." He looked haughtily at me, waiting for me to leave. See
haughty
More examplesFewer examples"I beg your pardon?" said Dolly haughtily. Simon's eyebrows lifted haughtily, as if surprised that anyone should question his methods.His first French teacher haughtily informed his students that "Cajun French wasn't real French."
